column4: hello. A a (still) Ubuntu-newbie i would like to know how I can start a file that is shown as "executable" on the desktop, but when I doubleclick it, I get the message that it can't be opened because "No application suitable for automatic installation is available for handling this kind of file"
gnu/linux is not windows, it has is owns programs
nope, the linux-version is free (at least that was said on one of the websites. It is downloadable here (the zip I downloaded): http://happypenguin.org/show?OceaniX
right clic>properties>permissions>aloud execute the file as a program
okay, will try next time I run into that issue. thanks as well
I think so. I have an nvidia-graphicscard installed which workes fine. Only that suddenly compositing isn't working anymore.
Do you have any tips on that issue?
it would make sence you share the output instead of especting us to guess ;)
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
Oops, sorry, I didn't mean Update-Manager, I meant Synaptic. I was just trying to install Midori and Synaptic wanted to remove a bunch of other apps totally unrelated to Midori.
then try: sudp apt-get install midori
There seems to be something wrong, as I get an "unmet dependencies"-error, regarding libwebkitgtk. And trying to reinstall it isn't working. Very strange.
what ubuntu version are you using¿
tried the Fix option for apt¿ sudo apt-get install -f
Yep, but that didn't change anything. Despite getting a "broken package"-message at some point, there does not really seem to be a broken package anywhere.
